thread.title: Ground News - What’s Working: Colorado workers can start taking paid family leave Jan. 1
thread.title_full: Ground News - What’s Working: Colorado workers can start taking paid family leave Jan. 1

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - What’s Working: Colorado workers can start taking paid family leave Jan. 1
text:
Summary by Ground News Colorado workers and their employers have built up a $775 million fund that will someday allow workers paid leave to care for a newborn, sick loved one or themselves. That day starts Jan. 1. It's the next stage of a state law that goes into effect in 2024, and it's joined by a handful of new labor laws and rules for the workplace. Another limits age discrimination of job applicants, another increases the minimum wage. Share menu More
